article_title: The Stock Market’s Shock is Surprising -- Heard on the Street
article_text:
The most surprising thing about the disappointing reports that knocked stocks lower on Tuesday may be that investors were surprised by them at all. They may also be surprised by how well the U.S. economy is doing, nonetheless.

Exhibit one: Caterpillar. The big equipment maker’s fourth-quarter earnings on Tuesday came in short of forecasts, and it drastically reduced its outlook for this year. The sharp decline in oil prices will hurt sales of energy equipment, the company said, while lower prices for copper, coal and iron...

twitter.description: The big things behind Tuesday’s drop in the stock market—falling oil and materials prices, slowing growth in China, a stronger dollar—shouldn’t have surprised investors. But they may obscure strengths in the U.S. economy.
twitter.creator: @jdlahart

image.alt: The stock market’s shock is surprising.
